notes: Public sector bodies must accept EU Digital Identity Wallets and notified eID schemes for cross-border authentication
Banks required to accept EUDI Wallets for customer authentication under AML requirements by late 2027
Insurance companies required to accept EUDI Wallets for customer identification under AML requirements
Healthcare providers may be required to accept EUDI Wallets; health credentials (vaccination, prescriptions) can be stored in wallets
Airlines and airports may accept EUDI Wallets for passenger identification and travel documents
Very Large Online Platforms (as defined in DSA) must offer EUDI Wallet login option by late 2027
Qualified trust service providers (QTSPs) directly regulated; must meet security and liability requirements
EUDI Wallet providers and identity verification services must comply with wallet issuance requirements
Manufacturing not directly in scope unless providing trust services or requiring strong customer authentication
Energy sector not directly in scope; may use EUDI Wallets for customer onboarding but not mandated
